metadata.synopsis: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
metadata.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A - oe und_arcane_poems (optional – do this if you want to unlock knowledge of the poems/passphrases)- goto -26.9, 52.2, -283.7

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *The automaton stands lifeless before you, gears silent, head low and heavy.*
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton's head is hanging down, but it's still standing otherwise.InternalNodeContext: Automaton is deactivated by antimagic field

24.speaker: Bernard
24.text: New sounds through damp and dark oppression break / Is it the foe, that foul, contemptuous heel?
24.context: NodeContext: He delivers his lines, then waits expectantly.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *You know these words - they are from the opening stanza of a play you found in this very tower.*

35.speaker: Player
35.text: 'Or art thou friend, a rescue from my lonely wake?'

2.speaker: Bernard
2.text: Come out of love for me, not love for blood and steel...
2.context: NodeContext: He bows, then waits, head stil bowed. Beat while still bowed, then looks at you expectantly. He straightens back up, not really knowing what to do.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Out of my way. I'm not interested in riddles.

1.speaker: Bernard
1.text: An unbeknownst command by fools that would intrude.
1.context: NodeContext: The automaton has received an unknown command - he's still in protect mode, so he's getting ready to kill the intruder who gave a wrong command.

21.speaker: Bernard
21.text: Now steel shall ring: false tongue will speak no more!
21.context: NodeContext: The automaton has received an unknown command - he's still in protect mode, so he's getting ready to kill the intruder who gave a wrong command.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'm a friend. I come in peace.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'm not foul or contemptuous, but I am a foe.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Attack it while it waits for an answer.

33.speaker: Bernard
33.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
12.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

37.speaker: Player
37.text: 'How can I trust? How will I ever know? / How can I show myself, my darkest me?'

48.speaker: Bernard
48.text: If you do not your deepest secrets show? / Reveal your truth, give what you wish to see.
48.context: NodeContext: The automaton repeats the lines, then bows and turns away.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: 'These empty sheets are all that's left of you. / The last of all the thoughtless gifts you gave.'

26.speaker: Bernard
26.text: I will hold onto them; it's all that I can do. / I can't throw them away; I've never been that brave.

13.speaker: Bernard
13.text: My fault, my fault - I've nothing left to give.
13.context: NodeContext: The robot is silent and pats his thighs, as if trying to find out if his pockets are empty, then bows several times, flustered. pause while patting down pockets

41.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton gives the player a gift offscreen (still unknown what the gift is, probably something small, like  a potion.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: 'There is a light in every living thing. / It's crawling t'wards the surface to survive.'

42.speaker: Bernard
42.text: And in its wake, it tramples everything. / We'll kill the rest, so that the one can thrive.
42.context: NodeContext: After delivering the line, the robot salutes.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: 'The silence stretches on - I'm all alone. / Please, can I hold your hands, for just a while?'

3.speaker: Bernard
3.text: Of course, my love. Don't be afraid, sweet girl.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *His hands close around the air next to your face, as if he's taking the hands of someone taller.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: He grabs the air with both hands, as if he's grabbing someone's hands.

53.speaker: Bernard
53.text: What can I do? Say, would you like a hug?
53.context: NodeContext: He's holding the air in his hands, as if he's holding two hands in his. A bit of a pause before "Say, do you want a hug.

23.speaker: Bernard
23.text: Come here. For just a moment. Let it out.
23.context:
NodeContext: He was holding the air in his hands. Now, he starts to hug the air, as if he's hugging a person who isn't there.
Voice: he's talking more slowly and more natural. A small pause before let it out.

46.speaker: Bernard
46.text: Remember: you are loved, Lenore. So much.
46.context: NodeContext: He's hugging the air, as if he's hugging a person and whispering in her ear.

49.speaker: Bernard
49.text: You're doing great. And everyone will be / so proud of you.
49.context: NodeContext: He's hugging the air, as if he's hugging a person and whispering in her ear.

19.speaker: Bernard
19.context: NodeContext: He was hugging the air, as if he was hugging a person, and now lets go, looking the imaginary person in the eye. Voice should be soft and sincere.

52.speaker: Bernard
52.text: You're strong. You're stronger than you ever knew.
52.context: NodeContext: He's still holding an imaginary person's hands.

8.speaker: Bernard
8.text: Remember. I am always here for you.
8.context: NodeContext: He was still holding an imaginary person's hands. Now, he releases them and caresses her face,

36.speaker: Bernard
36.text: And you will never walk this path alone.

16.speaker: Bernard
16.text: What can I do? Say, would you like a hug?
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton takes the player's hands in his. (only for normal height players)NodeContext: A bit of a pause before "Say, do you want a hug.

54.speaker: Bernard
54.text: Come here. For just a moment. Let it out.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton takes the player into a hug (only players of normal height)NodeContext: he's talking more slowly and more natural. A small pause before let it out.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *His arms are too tight and too low for a comfortable hug - as if he's meant to be embracing someone slightly shorter.*
38.context: NodeContext: The automaton is hugging you firmly.

20.speaker: Bernard
20.text: Remember: you are loved, Lenore. So much.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton is hugging the player and whispering into their ear. (normal size players only)NodeContext: He's hugging the player and whispering into their ear.

60.speaker: Bernard
60.text: You're doing great. And everyone will be / so proud of you.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton is hugging the player and is whispering into their ear. (normal size players only)NodeContext: He's hugging the player and whispering into their ear.

11.speaker: Bernard
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton releases the player from the hug (normal size players only)NodeContext: The automaton released the player from the hug, and is looking at them. He's very sincerely saying he's proud of them.

5.speaker: Bernard
5.text: You're strong. You're stronger than you ever knew.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still holding the player's hands.

18.speaker: Bernard
18.text: Remember. I am always here for you.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton releases the player's hands and caresses the player's cheek.

56.speaker: Bernard
56.text: And you will never walk this path alone.

17.speaker: Bernard
17.text: An unbeknownst command that I cannot fulfil.

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Long hours spent studying at your college come back to you - this is the opening stanza of an old play, 'The Roads to Darkness'.*

39.speaker: Bernard
39.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
39.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.
